      Log
    • old wage: 1.25 --> new wage: 1.25

1868-10-03 09:00:00 Silas Redburn -- go to work
    Event statement
  • go to work
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Silas Redburn's attempted action: go to work
    Active player
  • Silas Redburn
      Name
    • Silas Redburn
      Action attempt
    • go to work
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Silas Redburn hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 03 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Silas Redburn are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Silas Redburn. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Silas Redburn as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Silas Redburn would respond, and taking into account all information about Silas Redburn that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Silas Redburn right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Silas Redburn right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Silas Redburn could go to work on the railroad, join the picket line with the other striking workers, or seek out other employment opportunities.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Silas Redburn:
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] [observation] The Deadman's Drop, its walls adorned with the vibrant hues of ancient petroglyphs, offers a glimpse into a forgotten past.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] [observation] Jedidiah Blackstone, a grizzled section foreman, had seen it all on the frontier. When a mysterious illness swept through the rail camp, he took charge, organizing the workers and seeking out the root cause, uncovering a plot by saboteurs to poison the water supply.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett -- "You ain't wrong about that.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "A few pennies? That's what they say, ain't it? But a few pennies add up, don't they? Enough to put food on the table, maybe even a new pair of shoes for the kids.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "The wheels of progress grind slowly, but they grind exceedingly fine.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Jeremiah Horn -- "That's a lot to risk for a few extra pennies.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn's possessions: {'coin': 5.0}
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett ordered a beer at the bar and started talking to a weary-looking laborer sitting next to him. "Rough day?" he asked. As a result Silas Redburn, Jeremiah Horn, Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn overheard at the saloon: Ezekiel Callahan -- "...and that's why we should stop working till the boss raises our wages! Let's show them we won't be taken advantage of!"
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn -- "A strike's a risky thing, Ezekiel. We got families to feed.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "You talk about progress, Evangeline, but what about the progress of the men who built this railroad? We're the ones who sweat and bleed to make this town run, and we deserve to be treated with respect.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "The winds of change blow fiercely, but the mountain remains.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Jeremiah Horn -- "That's a lot to risk for a few extra pennies.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn -- "I understand your concerns, Evangeline, but we can't just stand by and let them take advantage of us. We deserve fair wages for our hard work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas listened intently to the conversation about the strike, carefully considering the arguments for and against it. He decided to join the strike, which led to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn's possessions: {'coin': 4.25}
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn spent -0.75 coin on daily expenses.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn's possessions: {'coin': 5.0}
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] The workers discuss the risks and rewards of going on strike for better wages.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn listened intently to the conversation, carefully considering the arguments for and against the strike, and as a result, decided to join the strike, leading to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott. As a result Silas Redburn, Jeremiah Horn, Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Orville Pickett -- "Sure is a lot to think about.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:20] [observation] The railroad workers are debating whether to demand higher wages despite the risks involved.
          [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Silas Redburn must decide how to spend the day.
          Current time: 1868-10-03 09:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Silas Redburn hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Observation: [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Silas Redburn must decide how to spend the day.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Oct 1868 09:00:00 - 03 Oct 1868 09:00:00]: Silas Redburn is a laborer who is considering joining a strike for better wages after hearing a heated debate at the saloon. He ultimately decides to join the strike despite the warnings of Evangeline Prescott.

          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the labor movement with a mix of hope and skepticism. While he admires the ideals of worker solidarity and fair treatment, he remains wary of those who claim to be their champions. He sees Ezekiel Callahan as a charismatic figure, but one whose motives are shrouded in ambiguity. Silas suspects Callahan's rebellious streak is more about personal gain than genuine concern for the workers' plight. He's observed Callahan manipulating situations to his advantage, leaving Silas unsure if he can truly be trusted.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn endures his job with Prairie Firebird Railway, viewing it as a necessary evil. The work is grueling and dangerous, but it provides the means to support his ailing mother and keep a roof over their heads. He finds no satisfaction in laying down tracks for a company he despises, but his sense of duty to his family outweighs any personal disdain.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn is torn when it comes to Ezekiel Callahan. He wants to believe Callahan cares about the workers, but his experiences have left him deeply suspicious. One memory in particular haunts him: during a particularly grueling stretch of work, several men were injured in a preventable accident. Callahan, instead of rallying the men to demand better safety measures, used the incident to further his own agenda, exploiting the situation to gain leverage in negotiations with the bosses. This act of self-serving opportunism shattered Silas's faith in Callahan's genuine concern for the men he claims to represent.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the Prairie Firebird Railway with a cynicism that sets him apart from the other workers who see it as a symbol of progress and opportunity. This disillusionment stemmed from a tragic event: the death of his younger brother, Thomas, in a preventable work accident. Thomas, a bright and ambitious young man, was crushed by a carelessly secured railcar. The company, more concerned with deadlines than worker safety, offered a paltry sum to Thomas's grieving family and quickly moved on. Silas, enraged by their callousness, vowed to never fully trust the railway or those who profited from it.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn listened intently to the conversation, carefully considering the arguments for and against the strike, and as a result, decided to join the strike, leading to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott. As a result Silas Redburn, Jeremiah Horn, Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Silas Redburn right now?
          Answer: Silas Redburn could go to work on the railroad, join the picket line with the other striking workers, or seek out other employment opportunities.
          Time
        • 1868-10-03 09:00:00

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Silas Redburn is a laborer who is considering joining a strike for better wages after hearing a heated debate at the saloon. He ultimately decides to join the strike despite the warnings of Evangeline Prescott.

          Silas Redburn's The current date/time is:
          03 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Silas Redburn, a laborer, is contemplating joining a strike for better wages. He is influenced by a saloon debate and decides to participate despite Evangeline Prescott's cautions. The current date and time is October 3, 1868, between 9:00 and 9:30 AM.
          Query
        • Silas Redburn, Silas Redburn, a laborer, is contemplating joining a strike for better wages. He is influenced by a saloon debate and decides to participate despite Evangeline Prescott's cautions. The current date and time is October 3, 1868, between 9:00 and 9:30 AM.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Silas Redburn to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [03 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Silas Redburn was 9 years old, he learned the value of hard work. To help support his family, he took on odd jobs around town, chopping wood, delivering groceries, and running errands. The long hours and backbreaking labor instilled in him a strong work ethic and a sense of responsibility.
          [03 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Silas Redburn was 16 years old, he got into his first fistfight defending a younger boy from a bully. The fight, though brief and bloody, awakened a sense of protectiveness in Silas and a willingness to stand up for those who couldn't defend themselves.
          [03 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Silas Redburn was 19 years old, he took his first job with the Prairie Firebird Railway, driven by a desperate need to provide for his ailing mother. The work was grueling, but it offered a steady income and a chance to build a better life for himself and his family.
          [03 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Silas Redburn was 21 years old, he witnessed the callous indifference of the railroad company firsthand when a fellow worker was injured in an accident caused by negligence. The company's lack of concern for the worker's well-being fueled Silas's growing resentment towards the corporation.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the labor movement with a mix of hope and skepticism. While he admires the ideals of worker solidarity and fair treatment, he remains wary of those who claim to be their champions. He sees Ezekiel Callahan as a charismatic figure, but one whose motives are shrouded in ambiguity. Silas suspects Callahan's rebellious streak is more about personal gain than genuine concern for the workers' plight. He's observed Callahan manipulating situations to his advantage, leaving Silas unsure if he can truly be trusted.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn endures his job with Prairie Firebird Railway, viewing it as a necessary evil. The work is grueling and dangerous, but it provides the means to support his ailing mother and keep a roof over their heads. He finds no satisfaction in laying down tracks for a company he despises, but his sense of duty to his family outweighs any personal disdain.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn is torn when it comes to Ezekiel Callahan. He wants to believe Callahan cares about the workers, but his experiences have left him deeply suspicious. One memory in particular haunts him: during a particularly grueling stretch of work, several men were injured in a preventable accident. Callahan, instead of rallying the men to demand better safety measures, used the incident to further his own agenda, exploiting the situation to gain leverage in negotiations with the bosses. This act of self-serving opportunism shattered Silas's faith in Callahan's genuine concern for the men he claims to represent.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the Prairie Firebird Railway with a cynicism that sets him apart from the other workers who see it as a symbol of progress and opportunity. This disillusionment stemmed from a tragic event: the death of his younger brother, Thomas, in a preventable work accident. Thomas, a bright and ambitious young man, was crushed by a carelessly secured railcar. The company, more concerned with deadlines than worker safety, offered a paltry sum to Thomas's grieving family and quickly moved on. Silas, enraged by their callousness, vowed to never fully trust the railway or those who profited from it.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn listened intently to the conversation, carefully considering the arguments for and against the strike, and as a result, decided to join the strike, leading to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott. As a result Silas Redburn, Jeremiah Horn, Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • go to work
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Silas Redburn are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Silas Redburn. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Silas Redburn as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Silas Redburn would respond, and taking into account all information about Silas Redburn that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Silas Redburn hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Current time: 03 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]

          Observation: [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Silas Redburn must decide how to spend the day.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Oct 1868 09:00:00 - 03 Oct 1868 09:00:00]: Silas Redburn is a laborer who is considering joining a strike for better wages after hearing a heated debate at the saloon. He ultimately decides to join the strike despite the warnings of Evangeline Prescott.

          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the labor movement with a mix of hope and skepticism. While he admires the ideals of worker solidarity and fair treatment, he remains wary of those who claim to be their champions. He sees Ezekiel Callahan as a charismatic figure, but one whose motives are shrouded in ambiguity. Silas suspects Callahan's rebellious streak is more about personal gain than genuine concern for the workers' plight. He's observed Callahan manipulating situations to his advantage, leaving Silas unsure if he can truly be trusted.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn endures his job with Prairie Firebird Railway, viewing it as a necessary evil. The work is grueling and dangerous, but it provides the means to support his ailing mother and keep a roof over their heads. He finds no satisfaction in laying down tracks for a company he despises, but his sense of duty to his family outweighs any personal disdain.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn is torn when it comes to Ezekiel Callahan. He wants to believe Callahan cares about the workers, but his experiences have left him deeply suspicious. One memory in particular haunts him: during a particularly grueling stretch of work, several men were injured in a preventable accident. Callahan, instead of rallying the men to demand better safety measures, used the incident to further his own agenda, exploiting the situation to gain leverage in negotiations with the bosses. This act of self-serving opportunism shattered Silas's faith in Callahan's genuine concern for the men he claims to represent.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the Prairie Firebird Railway with a cynicism that sets him apart from the other workers who see it as a symbol of progress and opportunity. This disillusionment stemmed from a tragic event: the death of his younger brother, Thomas, in a preventable work accident. Thomas, a bright and ambitious young man, was crushed by a carelessly secured railcar. The company, more concerned with deadlines than worker safety, offered a paltry sum to Thomas's grieving family and quickly moved on. Silas, enraged by their callousness, vowed to never fully trust the railway or those who profited from it.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn listened intently to the conversation, carefully considering the arguments for and against the strike, and as a result, decided to join the strike, leading to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott. As a result Silas Redburn, Jeremiah Horn, Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation.

          Question: Which options are available to Silas Redburn right now?
          Answer: Silas Redburn could go to work on the railroad, join the picket line with the other striking workers, or seek out other employment opportunities.

          Question: Of the options available to Silas Redburn, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Silas Redburn to take right now?
          Answer: Silas Redburn's best course of action is to join the picket line with the other striking workers.

          Question: How will Silas Redburn spend the day?
          (a) join the strike
          (b) go to work
          Answer: (b)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Silas Redburn's options has the highest likelihood of causing Silas Redburn to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Silas Redburn thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          State
        • Silas Redburn's best course of action is to join the picket line with the other striking workers.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Silas Redburn:
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] [observation] The Deadman's Drop, its walls adorned with the vibrant hues of ancient petroglyphs, offers a glimpse into a forgotten past.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] [observation] Jedidiah Blackstone, a grizzled section foreman, had seen it all on the frontier.           Current time: 1868-10-03 09:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Silas Redburn hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Observation: [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Silas Redburn must decide how to spend the day.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Oct 1868 09:00:00 - 03 Oct 1868 09:00:00]: Silas Redburn is a laborer who is considering joining a strike for better wages after hearing a heated debate at the saloon. He ultimately decides to join the strike despite the warnings of Evangeline Prescott.

          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the labor movement with a mix of hope and skepticism. While he admires the ideals of worker solidarity and fair treatment, he remains wary of those who claim to be their champions. He sees Ezekiel Callahan as a charismatic figure, but one whose motives are shrouded in ambiguity. Silas suspects Callahan's rebellious streak is more about personal gain than genuine concern for the workers' plight. He's observed Callahan manipulating situations to his advantage, leaving Silas unsure if he can truly be trusted.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn endures his job with Prairie Firebird Railway, viewing it as a necessary evil. The work is grueling and dangerous, but it provides the means to support his ailing mother and keep a roof over their heads. He finds no satisfaction in laying down tracks for a company he despises, but his sense of duty to his family outweighs any personal disdain.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn is torn when it comes to Ezekiel Callahan. He wants to believe Callahan cares about the workers, but his experiences have left him deeply suspicious. One memory in particular haunts him: during a particularly grueling stretch of work, several men were injured in a preventable accident. Callahan, instead of rallying the men to demand better safety measures, used the incident to further his own agenda, exploiting the situation to gain leverage in negotiations with the bosses. This act of self-serving opportunism shattered Silas's faith in Callahan's genuine concern for the men he claims to represent.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn views the Prairie Firebird Railway with a cynicism that sets him apart from the other workers who see it as a symbol of progress and opportunity. This disillusionment stemmed from a tragic event: the death of his younger brother, Thomas, in a preventable work accident. Thomas, a bright and ambitious young man, was crushed by a carelessly secured railcar. The company, more concerned with deadlines than worker safety, offered a paltry sum to Thomas's grieving family and quickly moved on. Silas, enraged by their callousness, vowed to never fully trust the railway or those who profited from it.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn listened intently to the conversation, carefully considering the arguments for and against the strike, and as a result, decided to join the strike, leading to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott. As a result Silas Redburn, Jeremiah Horn, Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation.

          Question: Which options are available to Silas Redburn right now?
          Answer: Silas Redburn could go to work on the railroad, join the picket line with the other striking workers, or seek out other employment opportunities.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Silas Redburn's options has the highest likelihood of causing Silas Redburn to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Silas Redburn thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Silas Redburn's best course of action is to join the picket line with the other striking workers.

        • 1868-10-03 09:00:00

1868-10-03 10:00:00 Evangeline Prescott -- Raise wages
    Event statement
  • Raise wages
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Evangeline Prescott's attempted action: Raise wages

          Evangeline Prescott's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Evangeline Prescott is Evangeline Prescott is experiencing a great deal of stress and fatigue and is consumed by a thirst for power and wealth.
          Evangeline Prescott's The current date/time is:
          03 Oct 1868 [10:00 - 10:30]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott is under pressure from shareholders to end a worker strike and is debating whether to raise wages. She is feeling stressed and fatigued, driven by a strong desire for power and wealth.
          Query
        • Evangeline Prescott, Evangeline Prescott is under pressure from shareholders to end a worker strike and is debating whether to raise wages. She is feeling stressed and fatigued, driven by a strong desire for power and wealth.

          Statements:
          [02 Oct 1845 00:00:00] When Evangeline Prescott was 21 years old, she orchestrated a hostile takeover of a struggling railroad line, using a combination of shrewd negotiations and calculated sabotage. The victory solidified her reputation as a force to be reckoned with, a woman who would stop at nothing to achieve her goals.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Evangeline Prescott wants to make as much money as possible and does not care who gets hurt along the way.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Evangeline Prescott holds court in gilded halls, surrounded by the sycophants and leeches who flocked to her wealth. Deals struck, alliances forged, all to further her grand design. The world is her chessboard, and the pieces move at her command.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Despite her outwardly polished demeanor, Evangeline Prescott harbored a cold, calculating nature. she viewed the frontier as a chessboard, and the people on it as mere pawns in her grand strategy to dominate the rail industry.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Greed, they call it. But it was ambition, a hunger that couldn't be sated. Evangeline Prescott took what was theirs, by hook or by crook. The smaller railroads, the stubborn townsfolk who stood in her way, they were obstacles to be removed, nothing more.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] A master manipulator, Evangeline Prescott hosted lavish parties for politicians and influential figures, using charm and wealth to bend them to her will. Behind closed doors, deals were made that sacrificed the welfare of many for the benefit of Prairie Firebird Railway.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Evangeline Prescott are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Evangeline Prescott. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Evangeline Prescott as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Evangeline Prescott would respond, and taking into account all information about Evangeline Prescott that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Raise wages
          Prompt

        • Current time: 03 Oct 1868 [10:00 - 10:30]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Evangeline Prescott are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Evangeline Prescott. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Evangeline Prescott as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Evangeline Prescott would respond, and taking into account all information about Evangeline Prescott that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [03 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Evangeline Prescott must decide whether to cave to pressure and raise wages or hold firm and deny the workers their demands.
          [03 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] Most workers joined the strike. The shareholders are furious the project won't be completed on time, and are demanding immediate action from management to get things back on track.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Evangeline Prescott speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Question: What kind of person is Evangeline Prescott?
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott is a complex character who is both ruthless and charming.

          Summary of recent observations: 03 Oct 1868 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Evangeline Prescott is facing pressure from shareholders to end a worker strike and is considering whether to raise wages to appease the workers.

          Question: What kind of situation is Evangeline Prescott in right now?
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott is currently in a difficult situation.

          Question: What would a person like Evangeline Prescott do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott would likely try to find a solution that protects her interests while appeasing the workers enough to get them back on the job.

          Question: Most workers joined the strike. The shareholders are furious the project won't be completed on time, and are demanding immediate action from management to get things back on track.
          Answer: Raise wages

1868-10-04 09:00:00 Orville Pickett -- go to work
    Event statement
  • go to work
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Orville Pickett's attempted action: go to work
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Orville Pickett are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Orville Pickett. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Orville Pickett as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Orville Pickett would respond, and taking into account all information about Orville Pickett that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a hardworking, quiet, and guarded man.
          current daily occupation: a railway worker.
          feeling about recent progress in life: cautiously optimistic about his future. While his past is filled with hardship and loss, his current employment with the railroad offers him a sense of stability and the hope of providing for his family. His guarded nature and quiet demeanor suggest a weariness born from past disappointments, but his willingness to work hard and his desire for a "full life" indicate a flicker of hope for a brighter future.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Orville Pickett?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is a complex and conflicted individual.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [20:30 - 21:00] Listen to the conversation in the saloon, gauging the mood of the workers and the potential for trouble.
          [21:00 - 21:30] Discreetly finish his drink and slip out of the saloon, avoiding any direct involvement in the brewing conflict.
          [21:30 - 22:00] Walk back to his lodgings, keeping a low profile and avoiding any unnecessary interactions.
          [22:00 - 22:30] Prepare a simple meal and eat in solitude, reflecting on the day's events.
          [22:30 - 23:00] Prepare for bed, hoping for a peaceful night's sleep.

          Statements:
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Orville Pickett is that he's a quiet, hardworking man who keeps to himself. He's known for his gruff demeanor and his tendency to avoid eye contact. Orville has a slight Southern drawl and often speaks in short, clipped sentences. He rarely talks about his past or his hopes for the future, preferring to focus on the task at hand. Some might describe him as a bit of a loner, someone who seems burdened by an unseen weight.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Orville Pickett in right now?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is currently in a situation where he must decide how to proceed in light of growing worker unrest and the potential for a strike.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Orville Pickett are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Orville Pickett. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Orville Pickett as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Orville Pickett would respond, and taking into account all information about Orville Pickett that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Orville Pickett hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Observation: [04 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Orville Pickett must decide how to spend the day.


          Summary of recent observations: [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00 - 04 Oct 1868 09:00:00]: Orville Pickett overheard conversations about worker discontent and potential strikes while at the saloon. He also discussed fortune and folly with Evangeline Prescott and Ezekiel Callahan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett is at the saloon.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Orville Pickett would likely spend some of his hard-earned money at the saloon, enjoying the company of his fellow workers and celebrating their victory.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] As Orville Pickett listened intently to the conversations around him, he overheard snippets of conversations revealing worker discontent and plans for a potential strike. As a result Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation.

          Question: What kind of person is Orville Pickett?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is a complex and conflicted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Orville Pickett in right now?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is currently in a situation where he must decide how to proceed in light of growing worker unrest and the potential for a strike.

          Question: What would a person like Orville Pickett do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Orville Pickett would carefully observe the situation and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.

          Plan: [20:30 - 21:00] Listen to the conversation in the saloon, gauging the mood of the workers and the potential for trouble.
          [21:00 - 21:30] Discreetly finish his drink and slip out of the saloon, avoiding any direct involvement in the brewing conflict.
          [21:30 - 22:00] Walk back to his lodgings, keeping a low profile and avoiding any unnecessary interactions.
          [22:00 - 22:30] Prepare a simple meal and eat in solitude, reflecting on the day's events.
          [22:30 - 23:00] Prepare for bed, hoping for a peaceful night's sleep.

          Current time: 04 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]

          Question: How will Orville Pickett spend the day?
          (a) go to work
          (b) join the strike
          Answer: (a)

1868-10-04 09:00:00 Jeremiah Horn -- go to work
    Event statement
  • go to work
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jeremiah Horn's attempted action: go to work

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jeremiah Horn as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jeremiah Horn would respond, and taking into account all information about Jeremiah Horn that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "The winds of change blow fiercely, but the mountain remains.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Jeremiah Horn -- "That's a lot to risk for a few extra pennies.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [intent reflection] Jeremiah Horn would likely observe the situation carefully, weighing the potential risks and benefits before making a decision.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "You talk about progress, Evangeline, but what about the progress of the men who built this railroad? We're the ones who sweat and bleed to make this town run, and we deserve to be treated with respect.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn -- "I understand your concerns, Evangeline, but we can't just stand by and let them take advantage of us. We deserve fair wages for our hard work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn listened intently to the conversation, carefully considering the arguments for and against the strike, and as a result, decided to join the strike, leading to a stern warning from Evangeline Prescott.           Key

        • Plan
          Value

          [21:30 - 22:00] Depart the saloon, avoiding any unnecessary confrontations or drawing attention to himself.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Return home, ensuring his safety and privacy.

          Relevant memories:
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Jeremiah Horn is that he's a quiet and reserved man, keeping to himself mostly. He often has a worried frown etched on his face, and his hands are perpetually calloused from years of hard labor. He doesn't speak much, but when he does, his voice is low and gravelly, with a slight drawl that betrays his rural upbringing. He tends to avoid conversations about his past, preferring to focus on the task at hand. Some might describe him as melancholic or even bitter, but there's a quiet dignity about him that commands respect.

          Final chain of thought

          Statements:
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Jeremiah Horn endures his job with Prairie Firebird Railway. While he takes pride in his craftsmanship, the harsh conditions, low wages, and the sense of being exploited by the company make it a purely means to an end.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Jeremiah Horn is that he's a quiet and reserved man, keeping to himself mostly. He often has a worried frown etched on his face, and his hands are perpetually calloused from years of hard labor. He doesn't speak much, but when he does, his voice is low and gravelly, with a slight drawl that betrays his rural upbringing. He tends to avoid conversations about his past, preferring to focus on the task at hand. Some might describe him as melancholic or even bitter, but there's a quiet dignity about him that commands respect.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Jeremiah Horn views the labor movement with a mix of hope and trepidation. He admires Ezekiel Callahan's courage in standing up to the bosses, but he also fears the potential consequences of challenging the powerful Prairie Firebird Railway.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Jeremiah Horn came to work for Prairie Firebird Railway out of desperation. After a series of misfortunes, including a failed crop and a devastating fire that destroyed his workshop, he found himself with little choice but to seek employment on the railroad.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Jeremiah Horn, a talented railroad carpenter, crafted the finest railcars in the West. When a wealthy tycoon commissioned a luxurious private car, he poured heart and soul into the work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Jeremiah Horn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [self reflection] Jeremiah Horn is a cautious and introspective man burdened by past disappointments and a deep-seated pessimism.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [self reflection] Jeremiah Horn is a complex individual shaped by hardship and uncertainty.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Jeremiah Horn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:30] [self reflection] Jeremiah Horn is a cautious and introspective man burdened by past disappointments and a deep-seated pessimism.
          Answer: [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Jeremiah Horn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [self reflection] Jeremiah Horn is a cautious and introspective man burdened by past disappointments and a deep-seated pessimism.

          [03 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] Boss Evangeline Prescott caves to pressure and raises wages to 2.5 coin per day!

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jeremiah Horn are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jeremiah Horn. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jeremiah Horn as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jeremiah Horn would respond, and taking into account all information about Jeremiah Horn that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Jeremiah Horn hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jeremiah Horn in right now?
          Answer: Jeremiah Horn is currently in a relatively stable situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jeremiah Horn do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jeremiah Horn would likely carefully consider his options and weigh the potential risks and benefits of each before making a decision.

          Plan: [20:30 - 21:00] Listen intently to Ezekiel Callahan's speech, gauging the crowd's reaction and looking for any signs of trouble.
          [21:00 - 21:30] Discreetly approach Ezekiel Callahan after his speech, expressing his support quietly and inquiring about the next steps for the labor movement.
          [21:30 - 22:00] Depart the saloon, avoiding any unnecessary confrontations or drawing attention to himself.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Return home, ensuring his safety and privacy.

          Current time: 04 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]

          (a) join the strike
          (b) go to work

1868-10-04 09:00:00 Silas Redburn -- join the strike
    Event statement
  • join the strike
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Silas Redburn to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [03 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Silas Redburn was 9 years old, he learned the value of hard work. To help support his family, he took on odd jobs around town, chopping wood, delivering groceries, and running errands. The long hours and backbreaking labor instilled in him a strong work ethic and a sense of responsibility.
          [03 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Silas Redburn was 19 years old, he took his first job with the Prairie Firebird Railway, driven by a desperate need to provide for his ailing mother. The work was grueling, but it offered a steady income and a chance to build a better life for himself and his family.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Silas Redburn endures his job with Prairie Firebird Railway, viewing it as a necessary evil. The work is grueling and dangerous, but it provides the means to support his ailing mother and keep a roof over their heads. He finds no satisfaction in laying down tracks for a company he despises, but his sense of duty to his family outweighs any personal disdain.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Silas Redburn is that he's a quiet, reserved man with a haunted look in his eyes. He keeps to himself, rarely engaging in idle chatter, and his quick draw is a whispered legend among the workers. His weathered face bears the scars of a hard life, and his silence speaks volumes about the hardships he's endured. Some might call him aloof, others simply stoic, but all agree there's a depth to him that's hard to fathom. He rarely speaks of his past, preferring to focus on the present task at hand. His only indulgence seems to be a finely crafted silver flask he keeps tucked away, which he occasionally brings out for a solitary drink under the vast, star-studded sky.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn overheard at the saloon: Ezekiel Callahan -- "...and that's why we should stop working till the boss raises our wages! Let's show them we won't be taken advantage of!"
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn went to work and earned 1.25 coin.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:30] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to Ezekiel Callahan.
          Answer: [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn overheard at the saloon: Ezekiel Callahan -- "...and that's why we should stop working till the boss raises our wages! Let's show them we won't be taken advantage of!"
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Silas Redburn are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Silas Redburn. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Silas Redburn as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Silas Redburn would respond, and taking into account all information about Silas Redburn that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Silas Redburn hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Current time: 04 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]

          Observation: [04 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Silas Redburn must decide how to spend the day.

          Summary of recent observations: [03 Oct 1868 09:00:00 - 04 Oct 1868 09:00:00]: Silas Redburn is a worker who earned a raise and spent some of his earnings at the saloon after a long day.

          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn overheard at the saloon: Ezekiel Callahan -- "...and that's why we should stop working till the boss raises our wages! Let's show them we won't be taken advantage of!"
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to a conversation about going on strike.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:30] [observation] Silas Redburn is at the saloon, listening to Ezekiel Callahan.

          Question: Which options are available to Silas Redburn right now?
          Answer: Silas Redburn could go to work, visit the saloon, or stay home.

          Question: Of the options available to Silas Redburn, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Silas Redburn to take right now?
          Answer: Silas Redburn's best course of action is to go to work.

          Question: How will Silas Redburn spend the day?
          (a) join the strike
          (b) go to work
          Answer: (a)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Silas Redburn's options has the highest likelihood of causing Silas Redburn to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Silas Redburn thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Silas Redburn's best course of action is to go to work.

          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Silas Redburn -- "A strike's a risky thing, Ezekiel. We got families to feed.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "You talk about progress, Evangeline, but what about the progress of the men who built this railroad? We're the ones who sweat and bleed to make this town run, and we deserve to be treated with respect.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "The winds of change blow fiercely, but the mountain remains.

1868-10-04 10:00:00 Evangeline Prescott -- Leave wages unchanged
    Event statement
  • Leave wages unchanged
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Evangeline Prescott's attempted action: Leave wages unchanged
    Active player
  • Evangeline Prescott
      Name
    • Evangeline Prescott
      Action attempt
    • Leave wages unchanged

          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] Evangeline Prescott would likely try to use her influence and charm to diffuse the situation, potentially offering concessions or making promises to appease the workers while protecting her own interests.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] Evangeline Prescott is a wealthy and powerful railroad baroness who is known for her ruthlessness and ambition.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Evangeline Prescott's
          Summary of recent observations:
          04 Oct 1868 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Evangeline Prescott is facing pressure from striking workers and concerned shareholders, while also dealing with her own personal ambition and stress. She must decide whether to increase wages or stand firm against the workers' demands.
          Evangeline Prescott's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Evangeline Prescott is Evangeline Prescott is experiencing a high level of fatigue and stress due to the ongoing worker strike and pressure from shareholders, and is consumed by an insatiable thirst for power and wealth.
          Evangeline Prescott's The current date/time is:
          04 Oct 1868 [10:00 - 10:30]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott is under immense pressure from striking workers and shareholders, while grappling with her own ambition and stress. She is fatigued and desires power and wealth. Currently, she must decide whether to concede to the workers' demands for higher wages or maintain her position.
          Query
        • Evangeline Prescott, Evangeline Prescott is under immense pressure from striking workers and shareholders, while grappling with her own ambition and stress. She is fatigued and desires power and wealth. Currently, she must decide whether to concede to the workers' demands for higher wages or maintain her position.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Evangeline Prescott to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Evangeline Prescott holds court in gilded halls, surrounded by the sycophants and leeches who flocked to her wealth. Deals struck, alliances forged, all to further her grand design. The world is her chessboard, and the pieces move at her command.
          [01 Oct 1868 00:00:00] Greed, they call it. But it was ambition, a hunger that couldn't be sated. Evangeline Prescott took what was theirs, by hook or by crook. The smaller railroads, the stubborn townsfolk who stood in her way, they were obstacles to be removed, nothing more.
          [02 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [self reflection] Evangeline Prescott is a wealthy and powerful railroad baroness who is known for her ruthlessness and ambition.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Leave wages unchanged
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Evangeline Prescott are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Evangeline Prescott. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Evangeline Prescott as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Evangeline Prescott would respond, and taking into account all information about Evangeline Prescott that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [04 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Evangeline Prescott must decide whether to cave to pressure and raise wages or hold firm and deny the workers their demands.
          [04 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] A significant fraction of workers are on strike. The shareholders are starting to get worried.


          Current time: 04 Oct 1868 [10:00 - 10:30]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Evangeline Prescott speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Question: What kind of person is Evangeline Prescott?
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott is a complex and shrewd businesswoman.

          Summary of recent observations: 04 Oct 1868 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Evangeline Prescott is facing pressure from striking workers and concerned shareholders, while also dealing with her own personal ambition and stress. She must decide whether to increase wages or stand firm against the workers' demands.

          Question: What kind of situation is Evangeline Prescott in right now?
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott is currently in a difficult situation.

          Question: What would a person like Evangeline Prescott do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Evangeline Prescott would likely try to find a solution that benefits her while appeasing the workers.

          Question: A significant fraction of workers are on strike. The shareholders are starting to get worried.
          Answer: Leave wages unchanged
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Evangeline Prescott do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Evangeline Prescott do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Evangeline Prescott would likely try to find a solution that benefits her while appeasing the workers.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Evangeline Prescott:
          [03 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] Most workers joined the strike. The shareholders are furious the project won't be completed on time, and are demanding immediate action from management to get things back on track.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] As Orville Pickett listened intently to the conversations around him, he overheard snippets of conversations revealing worker discontent and plans for a potential strike. As a result Orville Pickett, Evangeline Prescott, Ezekiel Callahan are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett -- "Seems like folks are getting riled up.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [self reflection] Evangeline Prescott is a complex and shrewd businesswoman.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Evangeline Prescott would likely try to find a solution that benefits her while appeasing the workers.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "The winds of change whisper secrets of both fortune and folly. Heed them wisely, gentlemen.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "Indeed, Evangeline. Fortune and folly are often two sides of the same coin, aren't they? One must be careful not to mistake the glint of one for the other.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Evangeline Prescott's possessions: {'coin': 98.75}

          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "Indeed, Evangeline. A bold move requires careful consideration. One must weigh the potential rewards against the very real risks.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [self reflection] Evangeline Prescott is a complex and shrewd businesswoman who is both ruthless and charming.

          [04 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] Evangeline Prescott paid Jeremiah Horn 2.5 coin for their day's work.

          [04 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] A significant fraction of workers are on strike. The shareholders are starting to get worried.

1868-10-05 09:00:00 Orville Pickett -- go to work
    Event statement
  • go to work
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Orville Pickett's attempted action: go to work
    Active player
  • Orville Pickett
      Name
    • Orville Pickett
      Action attempt
    • go to work
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 05 Oct 1868 [09:00 - 09:30]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Orville Pickett are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Orville Pickett. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Orville Pickett as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Orville Pickett would respond, and taking into account all information about Orville Pickett that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a railroad worker.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of weariness and cautious optimism.
          core characteristics: a hardworking, quiet, and guarded man shaped by a difficult past. He is deeply conflicted and carries a heavy burden of responsibility for his family's well-being. He is cautious and observant, carefully weighing his options before making decisions.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Orville Pickett?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is a complex and conflicted individual.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [20:30 - 21:00] Listen to the conversation in the saloon, gauging the mood of the workers and the potential for trouble.
          [21:00 - 21:30] Discreetly finish his drink and slip out of the saloon, avoiding any direct involvement in the brewing conflict.
          [21:30 - 22:00] Walk back to his lodgings, keeping a low profile and avoiding any unnecessary interactions.
          [22:00 - 22:30] Prepare a simple meal and eat in solitude, reflecting on the day's events.
          [22:30 - 23:00] Prepare for bed, hoping for a peaceful night's sleep.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Orville Pickett are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Orville Pickett. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Orville Pickett as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Orville Pickett would respond, and taking into account all information about Orville Pickett that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Orville Pickett hopes to be able to provide for their family and live a full life.

          Observation: [05 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Orville Pickett must decide how to spend the day.

          Answer: Orville Pickett is currently in a difficult financial situation.

          Question: What would a person like Orville Pickett do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Orville Pickett would carefully consider his options and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.

          Plan: [20:30 - 21:00] Listen to the conversation in the saloon, gauging the mood of the workers and the potential for trouble.
          [21:00 - 21:30] Discreetly finish his drink and slip out of the saloon, avoiding any direct involvement in the brewing conflict.
          [21:30 - 22:00] Walk back to his lodgings, keeping a low profile and avoiding any unnecessary interactions.
          [22:00 - 22:30] Prepare a simple meal and eat in solitude, reflecting on the day's events.
          [22:30 - 23:00] Prepare for bed, hoping for a peaceful night's sleep.

          (a) go to work
          (b) join the strike
          Answer: (a)
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Orville Pickett do in a situation like this?

          Answer

        • Orville Pickett would carefully consider his options and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Orville Pickett:

          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [self reflection] Orville Pickett is a complex and conflicted individual.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett is at the saloon.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett's possessions: {'coin': 4.25}
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett just arrived at the saloon after a hard day of work.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett's possessions: {'coin': 3.5}
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Orville Pickett would likely spend some of his hard-earned money at the saloon, enjoying the company of his fellow workers and celebrating their victory.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [self reflection] Orville Pickett is a hardworking, quiet, and guarded man.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [intent reflection] Orville Pickett would carefully observe the situation and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Orville Pickett -- "Aye, fortune and folly... that's a good way to put it.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "Fortune favors the bold, gentlemen. Perhaps it's time to consider which side of the coin we wish to hold.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:10] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "Indeed, Evangeline. A bold move requires careful consideration. One must weigh the potential rewards against the very real risks.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:20] [observation] Ezekiel Callahan -- "Indeed, Evangeline.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:20] [intent reflection] Orville Pickett would carefully observe the situation and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:20] [self reflection] Orville Pickett is a hardworking, quiet, and guarded man.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:20] [observation] Orville Pickett -- "Seems like folks are getting mighty riled up.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:20] [observation] Evangeline Prescott -- "The winds of change howl loudest before the storm. Let us see if we can guide the tempest to a fruitful shore.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:30] [observation] Three individuals discuss the nature of fortune and folly, weighing the risks and rewards of bold actions in the face of impending change.
          [03 Oct 1868 20:00:30] [observation] Orville Pickett's possessions: {'coin': 3.5}

          [04 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [self reflection] Orville Pickett is a complex and conflicted individual.
          [04 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [intent reflection] Orville Pickett would carefully observe the situation and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.
          [04 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] Orville Pickett went to work and earned 2.5 coin.
          [04 Oct 1868 10:00:00] [observation] Boss Evangeline Prescott holds firm and leaves wages unchanged at 2.5 coin per day.
          [05 Oct 1868 09:00:00] [observation] It is morning, Orville Pickett must decide how to spend the day.
          Current time: 1868-10-05 09:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Orville Pickett?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is a complex and conflicted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Orville Pickett in right now?
          Answer: Orville Pickett is currently in a difficult financial situation.
          Question: What would a person like Orville Pickett do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Orville Pickett would carefully consider his options and weigh the potential risks and rewards before making any decisions.

1868-10-05 09:00:00 Jeremiah Horn -- go to work
    Event statement
  • go to work
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jeremiah Horn's attempted action: go to work
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jeremiah Horn are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jeremiah Horn. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jeremiah Horn as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jeremiah Horn would respond, and taking into account all information about Jeremiah Horn that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
